I, I, hereby give you the following property settlement document, which is a document that I have written and given to you, stating that I, my husband, have inherited the property as per the schedule below, which is in full ownership and has been inherited by me through my father, and that I have acquired it for 800 years. I, my husband, out of love, affection and affection for you, have chosen love as a reward and without expecting or receiving any reward, I hereby transfer to you the property shown below for a sum of Rs. 5,61,000/- in letters five lakhs sixty-one thousand rupees, which is in full ownership and I have given it to you free of charge. Therefore, from now on, you will enter into the said property with full rights and pay the Panchayat taxes, transfer the Panchayat taxes etc. in your name, and according to your will, you will enjoy it with all rights, suitable for exchange and sale, as a gift, for your sons and grandsons. And I certify that there are no civil and criminal cases pending in any court on the property of the schedule shown in this document and that it is not the property assigned by the Government, nor is it the property of the Government, nor is it the property mortgaged to the Government, nor is it the property allocated by the Government for public use, and this is hereby certified. This is a settlement document given in writing with my consent. This property is not an assignment property. I declare that the property shown in the deed is true and correct. Neither I nor my heirs nor my agents on my behalf have ever alienated the property as per the Schedule by any agreement, bank loan or other arrangement, sale or free of charge, by way of partition or by way of release of rights. If any claim or dispute is made by any person in the future regarding the property as per the Schedule, we shall be liable to civil and criminal proceedings as per the law. What kind of endorsement is there for the said document to the authorities concerned with registration? This is a written and voluntary acceptance and settlement document given by us in good faith and without any inducement. : Declaration : I hereby declare that the property transferred by this deed has not been transferred by me to any person under any agreement or by way of lease, sale, subrogation, etc. by any person or any other person. boundaries.boundaryS: House of D Venkatesh and Street Way

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 1652 of 2025 , dated 26/May/2025, executed B. Bharathi, in favour of her Husband, B. Munivelu, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 89.44 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 312, Assessment No. 514, comprised in survey number 72/2, situated in Arai Village, KVB Puram Mandal, within the District of Tirupati, registered at sub-registrar office Thottambedu, is bounded as follows: North by: Donar's Vacant Land South by: House of D Venkatesh and Street Way East by: House of Gopi West by: Donar's Vacant Land

(A) As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 72/2, bearing house number 312, Assessment No. 514, situated in Arai Village measuring about 89.44 Sq. Yds, was originally owned by B. Bharathi , Who Property acquired from the father’s lineage. [REF:Deed] 2. The aforementioned B. Bharathi, executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 26/May/2025, registered as Doc.No. 1652 of 2025, before the SRO Thottambedu, in favour of her Husband, B. Munivelu, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 89.44 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 312, Assessment No. 514, comprised in survey number 72/2, situated in Arai Village.[*Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed] (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : 1. The Property Tax Receipt No. 3384, dated 09/Feb/2023, imprinted by the Arai Panchayath Secretary discloses that B. Bharathi has paid property tax towards Assessment No. 514. Note :The attached property tax receipt does not discloses the period for which the property tax is paid towards Assessment No 514. Hence it is advisable to verify that the tax is paid up-to-date towards the schedule property. Further It is to be noted that in deed the house number is given but however it is not mentioned in Tax receipt. Hence, it is advisable for the F.I. to verify the details and proceed in accordance with the internal policy and process. 2. Encumbrance Certificate vide Statement No. 139962644, dated 30/Jan/2026, extracted for the with respect to the Schedule Property does not reflect any adverse entries, other than those mentioned above.
The HTR attached discloses that B. Bharathi, is the taxpayer, hence, it is presumed that the mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner B. Munivelu.

contentList: Document Name * Document Description * Document Date * Document Type

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I. policy and have concluded that the B. Munivelu, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property measuring 89.44 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 312, Assessment No. 514, comprised in survey number 72/2, situated in Arai Village, KVB Puram Mandal, within the District of Tirupati registered at sub-registrar office Thottambedu (1021).

Further, the current owner, B. Munivelu is to be added as a party to the loan structure along with the applicant B. Bharathi.

Note:It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
